definition[0]: when someone buys something that they previously had sold
example[0]: Good economic data strengthened sterling and prompted buybacks of the currency.
example[1]: Porsche’s buyback scheme will guarantee a value of 55% of the car’s purchase price at the end of three years.
definition[1]: when a company buys its own shares from existing shareholders
definition[2]: when the owners of a company previously sold to another become independent again by buying their shares from the new owners
example[2]: William A Robinson, a Chicago marketing agency acquired three years ago by Ketchum Communications, completed its buyback from Ketchum and renamed itself Robinson & Maites.
